Chi
    
    
    
    
    
Current Chi
  y
Chi Masteries
Select all trained Chi Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Responsive Chi
Chi can be used again after 4 SR; this is treated the same as 4 SR reload for a weapon.
Countering Chi
Any attempt to use Chi against the character reduces the damage inflicted by attacking Chi by 1 per current Chi Skill rating. This does not count as a use of the Chi skill for purposes of determining number of uses per Sequenced Phase and does not lower the character’s current Chi Skill score.
Disruptive Chi
Modify the current Chi score by -2d10 when touching or striking an opponent to attempt to stun or kill the target.
Dodge
  y
Dodge Masteries
Select all trained Dodge Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Intuitive Dodge
A successful Awareness check made without modifiers allows the combatant to apply the normal Dodge bonus to an attack even if the attack was not perceived.
Reflexive Dodge
Forgo all attacks and non-movement actions for the Sequenced Phase to gain +5 Dodge rating against all attacks. Reflexive Dodge must be declared on the character’s first active SR of the Sequenced Phase.
Grapple
  y
Grapple Masteries
Select all trained Grapple Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Control Foe
The combatant can position a controlled opponent to block attacks and may use the foe as a shield of the same size category to parry incoming attacks.
Takedown
The combatant is adept at taking down opponents and can achieve a takedown result on opposed Grapple checks that succeed by 1 higher than the opponent’s roll.
Submission Hold
The combatant is adept at subduing opponents and may damage one limb or attempt to hold the grapple until the end of the next Sequenced Phase to force the controlled target to make a Physical Conditioning check to remain conscious on opposed Grapple checks that succeed by 3 higher than the opponent’s roll.
Mounted Combat

Mounted Combat Masteries

None

Unarmed Strike
  y
Unarmed Strike Masteries
Select all trained Unarmed Strike Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Disarming Strike
Disarm an opponent. The attacker may choose to take the dropped weapon into a free hand instead of allowing the weapon to drop.
Slashing Strike
Unarmed Strike attack damage counts as slashing damage instead of blunt. Slashing Strike must be declared prior to attacking.
Piercing Strike
Unarmed Strike attack damage counts as puncture damage instead of blunt. Piercing Strike must be declared prior to attacking.
Nimble Strike
Sweeping and Multiple attacks made with Unarmed Strike skill rating reduce the combatant’s Dodge rating by a maximum on 2 rather than the usual penalty of 5.
Sundering Strike
Each attack rating subtracted from the attack adds 5 to the durability check and break item damage of the Unarmed Strike attack. Sundering Attack must be declared prior to attacking.
Battle Punch
A rapid flurry of punches executed in a fist-over-fist series of strikes. The combatant must use two hands free to carry out a Battle Punch. Both hands conduct attacks using the same attack roll; on a successful hit, damage is rolled for each hand separately to the same hit location.
Simultaneous Attack and Defend
When using Unarmed Strike skill rating to parry an attack, immediately follow the parry action with an Unarmed Strike attack on the same enemy. the attack cannot be parried unless the target also has the Simultaneous Attack and Defend Unarmed Strike Mastery and is using Unarmed Strike skill rating to parry.
Counter Missiles
Parry thrown and launched missile weapons of a size category equal to or smaller than that of the character. One missile that was thrown at the combatant may be caught in each hand per SR.
Unarmed Throw
  y
Unarmed Throw Masteries
Select all trained Unarmed Throw Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Guided Throw
Unarmed Throw attacks that succeed by 2 or more allow the combatant to place the prone target anywhere within 5 feet of the attacker’s position.

Skill Notes W

Combat Skill (Weapon)
Score

Stat Mod

Masteries
Archery
  y
Archery Masteries
Select all trained Archery Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Fleeting Shot
Movement, either by the target or the shooter, does not result in the usual -1 to Attack rolls.
Many Arrows
Character may load and fire two arrows in a single attack. One attack roll is made at -2 for both arrows and the arrows must be fired at the same target or separate targets within a 30-degree arc of each other. Hit location is determined separately for each arrow.
Bludgeon
  y
Bludgeon Masteries
Select all trained Bludgeon Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Power Stroke
The character has mastered a swirling technique that adds power to the strike of a bludgeoning weapon. Add 1 to the damage delivered by successful attacks.
Crossbow
  y
Crossbow Masteries
Select all trained Crossbow Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
None

Fencing, lg Blades
  y
Fencing, Large Blades Masteries
Select all trained Fencing, Large Blades Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Skilled Deflection
Large Blades may be used to parry attacks from weapons and opponents of up to one size category larger than the wielded Large Blade’s size.
Deadly Arc
Sweeping attacks made with Large Blades skill rating reduce the combatant’s Dodge rating by a maximum on 3 rather than the usual penalty of 5.
Rear Parry
The character is extremely flexible and quick at parrying with a Large Blade and may use a Large Blade to parry an attack originating from a direction the character is not facing at half effectiveness (-1 to the attack for each 2 Attack Rating used).
Quick Reversal
Delay between subsequent attacks or parries from Large Blades are reduced by 1 SR; a delay of only one unusable SR is required to bring the weapon once again into usable position.
Fencing, sm Blades
  y
Fencing, Small Blades Masteries
Select all trained Fencing, Small Blades Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Nimble Blade Strike
Sweeping and Multiple Attacks made with the FencingSmall Blades skill reduce the Dodge rating by a maximum of 2 rather than the usual maximum penalty of 5.
Off-hand Blade Mastery
No off-hand penalty when using a Small Blade in a nonfavored hand.
Deflect Missiles
Fencing - Small Blades Attack rating may be used to parry thrown and launched missile weapons of a size category equal to or smaller than that of the weapon used.
Net
  y
Net Masteries
Select all trained Net Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
None

Polearm
  y
Polearm Masteries
Select all trained Polearm Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Skilled Deflection
Pole Arms may be used to parry attacks from weapons and opponents of up to one size category larger than the wielded Pole Arm’s size.
Expert Tripper
The entire Pole Arm attack rating may be used for opposed skill checks to trip opponents rather than just the Pole Arm attack rating used to make the attack. The combatant must be using a pole arm with the Trip descriptor. Trip attacks can be executed against opponents up to one size category larger than the combatant.
Nimble Polearm Strike
Sweeping and Multiple Attacks made with the Pole Arm skill reduce the Dodge rating by a maximum of 3 rather than the usual maximum penalty of 5.
Sling
  y
Sling Masteries
Select all trained Sling Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
None

Shield
  y
Shield Masteries
Select all trained Shield Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Shield Deflect
Shields may be used to parry attacks from weapons and opponents of up to one size category larger than the wielded shield’s size.
Economy of Motion
The number of SR required to reposition a shield after a parry or attack action before another parry or attack action can be completed is reduce to 1 SR. Bucklers wielded by a combatant with the Economy of Motion shield mastery receive Block 2 and may still be used in consecutive SR.
Simultaneous Block and Attack
When using a shield to parry an attack, immediately follow the parry action with an attack on the same enemy using any other welded weapon; in order to carry out the attack, the weapon must be in position and ready to use.
Rear Block
The character is extremely flexible and quick at positioning a shield and may use a shield to parry an attack originating from a direction other than its designated facing at half effectiveness (-1 to melee or thrown weapon attacks for each 2 shield Rating used or -1 to the nonthrown ranged attacks for every 4 shield Rating used).
Thrown Weapon
  y
Thrown Weapon Masteries
Select all trained Thrown Weapon Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Catch Missiles
Throw Weapon Attack rating may be used to catch thrown and launched missile weapons of a size category equal to or smaller than that of the character. Any thrown weapon caught is immediately ready for use.

Acrobatics
  y
Acrobatics Masteries
Select all trained Acrobatics Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Fleet-footed
Receive +2 to all checks required for doubling hurried movement.
Cat-like Balance
Receive +2 to all checks required for maintaining balance.
Roll with the Punches
Receive +2 to all checks required to resist being knocked back by attacks.
Awareness
  y
Awareness Masteries
Select all trained Awareness Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Investigator
When searching for clues at a crime scene or details related to activity at a location, first make an Intelligence check and add a bonus equal to the result minus 11 to the Awareness check to investigate the scene; if the Intelligence check fails, no penalty is incurred.
Detail Oriented
When searching an area for secret or hidden items, first make an Intelligence check and add a bonus equal to the result minus 11 to the Awareness check to conduct the search; if the Intelligence check fails, no penalty is incurred.

Meditate
  y
Meditate Masteries
Select all trained Meditate Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Focused Meditation - Chi
In addition to the normal recovery granted by meditation, recover 5 extra Chi per hour for each point the skill check exceeds 11.
Focused Meditation - Mana
In addition to the normal recovery granted by meditation, recover 3 extra Mana per hour for each point the skill check exceeds 11.
Focused Meditation - Psyche
In addition to the normal recovery granted by meditation, recover 3 extra Psyche per hour for each point the skill check exceeds 11.
Focused Meditation - Resilience
In addition to the normal recovery granted by meditation, recover 2 extra Resilience per hour for each point the skill check exceeds 11.
Physical Conditioning
  y
Physical Conditioning Masteries
Select all trained Physical Conditioning Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Scrapper
Receive +2 to all checks for Flagging penalty and recover up to 2 Flagging penalty at the end of a Sequenced Phase in which action is restrained.

Spell Retention
  y
Spell Retention Masteries
Select all trained Spell Retention Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Heroic Focus
Character may retain one Spell Focus without retaining its lesser tiers. Preparing a Focus still requires the progression of Foci of lesser tiers be prepared first; thereafter, the lesser progressions for a single Focus may be retrained.

Nimble Hands
  y
Nimble Hands Masteries
Select all trained Nimble Hands Masteries. Also select the checkbox on the skill listing to indicate there are masteries.
Pilfer
The character has mastered techniques for lifting valuables and small objects from nearby folk and unwary shopkeepers. Pilfer Nimble Hands Mastery grants + 2 to all Nimble Hands skill checks made to snatch small objects from others or from nearby shelves without being noticed. Pilfer Nimble Hands Mastery can also aid Nimble Hands skill checks to secretly place objects.
Legerdemain
Most commonly learned by spell casters to hide the gesticulations needed to aid casting of spells. +2 to all Nimble Hands skill checks made to perform feats of legerdemain such as secretly stashing or retrieving objects in pockets on the character’s person or casting spells without revealing hand gestures.

Vaulting Mount/Dismount

Riding Tricks
Successful Ride check allows the rider to use the mount as cover by hanging from the side of the mount, stand on saddle or back of the mount, or turn facing in the saddle to either side or the rear (returning to normal facing requires another skill check).

Weapon is lodged in target.
Unless attacker removes the weapon, target may not use the location struck without first succeeding in a Valor check but using the hit location inflicts an additional point of Resilience damage. Once per Sequenced Phase, the target may attempt a Valor check to remove the projectile as a 1 SR action, inflicting 1 additional Resilience damage. Removing the projectile with a successful Medical Lore check requires 3 SR and inflicts no additional damage. No Valor check is required if the projectile is removed by another.

Weapon is lodged in target.
Unless attacker removes the weapon, target may not use the location struck without first succeeding in a Valor check but using the hit location inflicts an additional point of Resilience damage. Once per Sequenced Phase, the target may attempt a Valor check to remove the projectile as a 1 SR action, inflicting 1 additional Resilience damage. Removing the projectile with a successful Medical Lore check requires 3 SR and inflicts no additional damage. No Valor check is required if the projectile is removed by another.

Weapon is lodged in target.
Unless attacker removes the weapon, target may not use the location struck without first succeeding in a Valor check but using the hit location inflicts an additional point of Resilience damage. Once per Sequenced Phase, the target may attempt a Valor check to remove the projectile as a 1 SR action, inflicting 1 additional Resilience damage. Removing the projectile with a successful Medical Lore check requires 3 SR and inflicts no additional damage. No Valor check is required if the projectile is removed by another.

{{halfcritdmg}} + {{strengthdmgmod}} {{typedescrip}}
{{/rollGreater() halfcritdmg strengthdmgmod}} {{#^rollGreater() halfcritdmg strengthdmgmod}}
{{halfcritdmg}} + {{halfcritdmg}} {{typedescrip}}
{{/^rollGreater() halfcritdmg strengthdmgmod}} {{/rollBetween() critroll 15 20}} {{#rollBetween() critroll 16 20}}
All damage
bypasses armor protection
{{/rollBetween() critroll 16 20}} {{#rollBetween() critroll 17 20}}
Incapacitate hit location
for {{d4}} Sequenced Phases, as if the target had failed a Stamina check from damage exceeding the hit location limit.
{{/rollBetween() critroll 17 20}} {{#rollGreater() critroll 17}}
Crush or break bones if attack damage exceeds location damage limit.
{{/rollGreater() critroll 17}}
{{/rollTotal() dmgtype 1}} {{#rollTotal() dmgtype 2}}
{{#rollLess() critroll 15}}
Damage
{{#rollGreater() rollresult strengthdmgmod}}
{{rollresult}} + {{strengthdmgmod}} {{typedescrip}}
{{/rollGreater() rollresult strengthdmgmod}} {{#^rollGreater() rollresult strengthdmgmod}}
{{rollresult}} + {{rollresult}} {{typedescrip}}
{{/^rollGreater() rollresult strengthdmgmod}} {{/rollLess() critroll 15}} {{#rollBetween() critroll 14 20}}
Weapon is lodged in target.
Unless attacker removes the weapon, target may not use the location struck without first succeeding in a Valor check but using the hit location inflicts an additional point of Resilience damage. Once per Sequenced Phase, the target may attempt a Valor check to remove the projectile as a 1 SR action, inflicting 1 additional Resilience damage. Removing the projectile with a successful Medical Lore check requires 3 SR and inflicts no additional damage. No Valor check is required if the projectile is removed by another.
{{/rollBetween() critroll 14 20}} {{#rollBetween() critroll 15 20}}

Weapon is lodged in target.
Unless attacker removes the weapon, target may not use the location struck without first succeeding in a Valor check but using the hit location inflicts an additional point of Resilience damage. Once per Sequenced Phase, the target may attempt a Valor check to remove the projectile as a 1 SR action, inflicting 1 additional Resilience damage. Removing the projectile with a successful Medical Lore check requires 3 SR and inflicts no additional damage. No Valor check is required if the projectile is removed by another.
